metadata.feature_description: Dynamically creates and manages content panes within the layout at runtime.

steps.action: Navigate to Home page and enable Edit mode
steps.expected: Edit mode should be enabled showing pane labels
steps.actual: Edit mode enabled successfully, pane labels visible

steps.action: Observe pane names for multiple Content Layout modules
steps.expected: Each Content Layout module should have unique pane name prefixes
steps.actual: Observed two Content Layout modules with unique prefixes: F30A_Pane1-4 and 9977_Pane1-4. The naming follows the GUID-based pattern defined in LayoutPanePrefixGenerator.cs

steps.action: Verify dynamic panes are registered and accessible in edit mode
steps.expected: Panes should be registered with the skin and accept modules
steps.actual: All dynamic panes (F30A_Pane1-4 and 9977_Pane1-4) are registered with the skin. Each pane shows 'Add Existing Module' link and can contain modules. Verified via DOM inspection that panes have proper IDs (dnn_F30A_Pane1, etc.)

steps.action: Observe pane labels visibility in edit mode
steps.expected: Pane labels should be visible in edit mode
steps.actual: Pane labels (e.g., F30A_PANE1, 9977_PANE4) are visible in edit mode when hovering or viewing the content layout

steps.action: Verify panes contain modules and display content
steps.expected: Panes should display their module content properly
steps.actual: All populated panes correctly display their module content (TELEVISIONS, WEARABLES, TABLETS, LAPTOPS, CAMERAS, BLU-RAY PLAYERS, MONITORS, HOME THEATERS)

steps.action: Inspect pane CSS classes via JavaScript DOM evaluation
steps.expected: Panes should have proper CSS classes including Bootstrap responsive classes
steps.actual: Verified via browser evaluation. Panes have classes: 'pane col-lg-3 col-md-3 col-sm-3 col-xs-12 dnnSortable dnnModuleManager ui-sortable ui-resizable'. The responsive grid classes (col-lg-3, col-md-3, col-sm-3, col-xs-12) match the 4-column layout template.

steps.action: Locate an empty pane in the Content Layout
steps.expected: Empty panes should have special styling with DNNEmptyPane and EditBarEmptyPane classes
steps.actual: 9977_Pane4 was initially empty and displayed 'Click to add text/image/module' buttons. After page refresh, it shows 'Click here to edit content' placeholder. DOM inspection confirmed empty pane has classes: 'pane col-lg-3 col-md-3 col-sm-3 col-xs-12 DNNEmptyPane dnnSortable EditBarEmptyPane EditBarEmptyPane dnnQuickAddModuleManager dnnModuleManager ui-sortable'

steps.action: Review code for pane name conflict handling
steps.expected: System should detect and handle pane name conflicts
steps.actual: Code review of View.ascx.cs confirms CheckPaneNamesConflicts() method exists at line 308. It iterates through panes and throws InvalidOperationException if a pane name already exists in the skin (IsPaneAlreadyInTheSkin checks Skin.Panes collection). Two different Content Layout modules on the same page have different prefixes (F30A and 9977), confirming unique name generation prevents conflicts.

observations: The LayoutPanePrefixGenerator.cs generates unique pane prefixes using a 4-character GUID substring format (e.g., 'F30A_Pane', '9977_Pane')
The pane naming convention follows the pattern {prefix}_Pane{N} where N is 1-based column index
Empty panes receive additional CSS classes (DNNEmptyPane, EditBarEmptyPane) as handled by ReplaceEmptyPaneClass() method in View.ascx.cs
Panes are registered with both PortalSettings.ActiveTab.Panes collection and Skin.Panes dictionary for proper integration with DNN's module management system
The data-parentpane attribute is added to panes in edit mode for tracking the parent skin pane relationship
